Reviews.Title: “Good value for Paris. Shabby chic, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tripper43
Reviews.Content: Good location, round the corner from the Rodin Museum. Close to Musee d'Orsay and Les Invalides. It's nothing special, but its perfectly fine and we found the reception staff to be very pleasant and helpful, in a low key, French way!! breakfast is in the basement and is basically juice and coffee with many, many pastries!

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: Jill P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Pros: The location of this hotel can't be beat if you need access to the 6th and 7th arondissments. The price is comparatively good for this location. It is quiet and comfortable with helpful staff at the desk. The in-room safe was a welcome addition. Cons: I had booked a regular room with a double bed but was given a room with a single bed which was a bit small as I'm nearly 6 feet tall. Breakfast was available in the morning but no staff were there to provide tea or coffee service, and the offerings were quite limited (clearly not worth the price). Recommended if you keep your expectations low.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely rude front desk, horribly small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Adventure3737
Reviews.Content: I travelled single to Paris so my where I stayed wasn't a big deal - I didn't expect to be in my room often, however my bathroom must have been a former closet. I'm only 5' tall yet when I sat on the toilet my knees touched the shower door !! The room was also had a musty smell to it. The front desk staff were horribly rude. Be warned that they also close the doors at 12 midnight. You must ring a bell should you come in after. I came in one night at 11:50 pm and the front desk attendent practically threw the keys at me. That's another inconvenience - you must leave your keys at the front desk every time you leave and pick them up when you come back in. It's not for security - 3rd day a desk attendent I had never seen gave me my keys without asking for any ID. I could have asked for any room number and he would have given them to me. I would NOT recommend this hotel ever to anyone staying in such a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JamesThomas2012
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel 3 times, and have always enjoyed a consistently pleasurable visit. It's extremely well priced and in a great location. Rooms are very clean, well appointed. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris experience”
Reviews.Author: Mark P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during late September 2011 and absoulutley enjoyed the experience. The front desk were friendly especially as my attempts at French improved. The rooms were massive compared to London and yes the kids room is compact as we did not spend much time in the hotel its was no problem. It is a very old building and if you are expecting a shiny new Hilton then you wil be dissappointed. If however you are after the experinece of being in Paris then I highly recommend this hotel.The street is quiet and has some lovely shops, the bakery was excellant and helpful. The location could not be better, just around the corner from a metro station, a few blocks away from the Siene River and close to some great resturants. Go there with realistic expectations and you will truley enjoy this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paris”
Reviews.Author: James W
Reviews.Content: The hotel was comfortable with a modern clean bathroom. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly, the continental breakfast superb. The hotel is conveniently located near Les Invalides, Rodin's musem and a metro station. There are excellent bakeries and restaurants on the street or just around the corner. You are a twenty minute walk from the Effiel Tower or a river cruise departure point near the bridge straight up from Les Invalides. Recommend Les Invalides, the French Army Museum. One of the premiere military museums in the world, but you knew that, its Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Geanne_54
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in a family room during the month of May. The room is quite large, clean and comfortable and the bathroom is modern. The staff is pleasant and helpful. Delicious breakfast.The hotel is located in a quiet and safe neighborhood, within walking distance to major attractions. There is a small supermarket a few steps away and a great italian restaurant,Giallo Oro, almost across the street. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne G
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at the Hotel du Palais Bourbon, our room was quite large, the beds were comfortable and it was very clean. The shower is hard to get in and out of; this is always true no matter where one stays in Paris. The location is excellent. There are not many tourists around so one feels really part of the scene. We often went to Le Basilic for dinner which is lively and has very good food and excellent service. There are not many other good choices near to the hotel but we were very satisfied to go there several times and were never disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint”
Reviews.Author: dugald1594
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our two college-age kids spent one night here before a cruise down the Seine to Normandy. We had a so-called suite for four, which comprised a double bed and two twins crammed into a small room. The furnishings were eclectic but adequate. The bathroom was small and awkward. I know, I've just described a typical budget Euro hotel room ..... The location is good, quiet at night but within walking distance of the major Paris attractions. The desk clerk could have come from Central Casting. The elevator is a two-person affair. The lobby is decorated with a strange mix of country furniture. Quaint. It's not the Ritz, but neither are the rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Rooms - Grumpy Front Desk People”
Reviews.Author: Cali_Cake
Reviews.Content: Finding a room in Paris that can accommodate 4 people can be a challenge. The Hotel du Palais Bourbon fit the bill, as they offer family rooms. Basically, this means a nice sized room for 2 people, and a tiny attached room for the kids. In our room, the attached was basically an oversized closet that barely held two twin beds. But at $220.00 Euro for the 4 of us, this was a deal to be snapped up. The location is great, very central. You can walk to the Eiffel Tower (about 10 min walk) and to the Rodin. The hotel shares the same streets as many of the consulets - so it's a good neighborhood. My main beef was with the front desk & the people running the place. The guy behind the desk was not very welcoming. This would not have been a huge deal, except that we were overlapping an evening with my family from Virginia. The front desk told them that we were not staying there. The front desk told me that they had never checked in (after a brief glance at a hand written register). On Facebook, I saw that my cousin had indeed checked in online to this hotel - and was sad I wasn't there. After insisting on another person checking (open the SAME hand written registry) they declare, oh yes, they were here. They are gone now. What jerks. Upon checkout, I told them we had reserved with the "special internet offer" of free breakfast, and to please remove it from my bill. He refused. I showed him the confirmation (from their hotel) with the internet offer. He said no, I needed to pay for the 3 days of continental breakfast anyway. He went back to smoking his cigarette. Welcome to Paris. Great hotel - crappy people & zero service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: sasak70
Reviews.Content: very nice and clean hotel, superb location yet quiet, helpful staff. Great family rooms, roomy and nicely furnished. Comfortable beds. I would definitely stay here again. The street was quiet (August), safe for kids, nice neigborhood. Modest breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely character, comfortable, accomodating staff, great location......”
Reviews.Author: ckohfield
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in room #11, a "family room" (small suite) on the third floor (there is a lift) that faced the quiet front street; there was a full bed in the main room and two single beds in an a separate bedroom- the layout of this room is a real value in Paris; had a mini-fridge, plenty of storage in armoires, a separate tub and shower, and 100% cotton soft linens on the beds; the immediate neighborhood is lovely and quiet yet very close to the touristsâ€™ must-sees; quality eateries frequented by Parisians are abundant and varied in this area, and a mini-market that is open late is conveniently a couple doors down from the hotel. Our teen son went down for the hotel breakfast in the mornings and enjoyed it; the wifi in the rooms works well, and there is a courtesy computer in a side room of the lobby; the small lobby wine bar offers a good reasonably priced selection that may be purchased to enjoy downstairs or taken to your room. The front desk arranged our early morning car service when we departed. This hotel has Parisian character with plenty of comfort and service; we would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: navigator6
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this lovely hotel-fantastic location near the Rodin Meuseum. The staff was extremely helpful. There is a restaurant right beside the hotel-Le sac a dos- that offeres wonderful authentic cooking. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, but beware... the breakfast cost 8 euros per person!”
Reviews.Author: kate7980
Reviews.Content: Our 5 day stay was generally pleasant. The hotel is very old and needs some updating, but is overall clean and comfortable. It is on a very narrow street in a very central location with about a 5 minute walk to the Musee Rodin and a Metro Station, and is next door to several cafes, bakeries, banks and grocery stores. The street itself, like all of Paris, is very picturesque and quiet (at night). The desk clerks (there were 4 total who each worked 12 hour shifts) were very polite and helpful, but did not seem to go out of their way to make us feel welcome. They all spoke English quite well, so check in was very quick and efficient. The hallways were dimly lit and narrow, but we managed. The elevator is TINY and really slow. It can only carry about 3 people. The rooms were a good size for Paris. We were not expecting much. Good luck opening the doors because they are impossible. It takes about 5 minutes just to unlock the door and pull it apart from the frame! The room consists of a larger 14 by 14 ft room with a queen size bed and a little attached room that is only 5 feet wide with 2 twin beds. It was nicely decorated with gray textured wallpaper, an adobe red ceiling and rustic style furniture. The bathrooms had a shower and a tub (two separate areas) but be careful! There is no shower curtain so the floor gets flooded every time. The toilet is in a different room (size of a portapotty) with a tiny sink. There are also toilets between the floors. Breakfast consisted of toast, croissants, pain du chocolat, baguettes, and flax seed bread. There was also hot chocolat, tea and coffee. Since the hotel menu stated " For your breakfast... Your room rate includes a continental breakfast" and judging by the reviews on this website, we were under the impression that the breakfast was complementary. None of the staff informed us that there was a 8 euro charge PER PERSON for the breakfast. If we had known, we would not have eaten in the hotel. The total for the breakfasts summed up to be about $300!! Imagine how unpleasantly surprised we were at checkout. Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay. I feel as if there was some manipulation on their part... apparently they changed their policy without bothering to update their menus. Every night when we got back, they would politely ask us how we wanted our breakfast... not once did they imply the surcharge. I suppose we should have asked point blank, but be very careful about these things! I had planned on writing a glowing review, but after this occurrence, I can't help but view this hotel in a more negative light. If you want a nice, reasonably priced hotel in a safe, central part of Paris, then I would recommend this place. But for a more honest, affordable place, I would suggest somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean Hotel nice area”
Reviews.Author: coleen
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the hotel very early to check in around 10am. The Manager told us the room was not ready but took our luggage and said they would have it ready as quickly as possible. He also offered information on a place to eat. The Hotel room which had 3 single beds was a good size room for the 3 of us with a good bathroom tea & coffee facilities and also a fridge which is all you could need. It was on a street with a small shop and a larger supermarket which was handy for supplies. It was just a few minutes from the metro which we used and also we could walk to eiffel tower in 15 mins. Breakfast was tea or coffee and baguettes crossiants plus a brown bread. If you wanted an omelette it cost 3 euros extra. On our first day we went to an near by bar/bistro which was down the streetwe turned right leaving hotel and walk to end of street. We had a good lunch there at a good price. When we wanted to go out at night we took taxi to bouluvard St Germain De Pre which cost about â‚¬10.We found plenty restaurants and bars here. We ate in cafe Louise and would recommend it. Overall we were pleased with the hotel and the room was good ,it was also in a nice quite area for night time sleep but only â‚¬10 taxi to nightlife. We found it good that it had a small shop near by and that it was close to metro

Reviews.Title: “nice quiet street - would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: xojanalove
Reviews.Content: yummy breakfast - huge croissants and baguettes each morning with coffee and tea. beds are small (twin) but my room was larger than I was expecting and bigger than my friends room. heehee no shower curtain but it managed to work that out without making a watery mess of the toilette. short walk to the Louvre, eiffel tower and yummy places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “This is a gem of a FRENCH Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrAlan
Reviews.Content: I have read several reviews of this hotel submitted by our American cousins and I wonder if they were at the same hotel I have just stayed at with my wife, two sons and daughters in law. Our room on the 5th floor was faultless, newly decorated and with an adequate bathroom. Breakfast did not, as reported in other reviews, consist of a basket of bread but rather baguettes, croissants, butter, jam and coffee - a normal French breakfast. Service throughout our short stay was perfectly adequate and there were no porters or waiters holding out their hands for tips at every turn.

Reviews.Title: “good value and excellent location for families”
Reviews.Author: BostonOdysseus
Reviews.Content: despite a less-than-stellar shower, this hotel served my purposes nicely...great locale for exploring ALL of Paris! breakfast was ok but the real key was a terrific family room for couples travelling with 2 teens. all in all, well done and clean!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - just watch out for the shower”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticutExporter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Palais Bourbon with our teenage son. Booked the family suite for 4 so we'd have a little extra space, which worked out well. Queen sized bed in one room and 2 single beds in the other. Large by Paris standards. Had the breakfast the 1st day, then opted for coffee & croissants at the local bakery down the street the rest of the week. Walking distance to Rodin Museum, Eiffel Tower, Musee D'Orsay, Grand Palais, Petit Palais. 2 blocks from Metro. Lots of cafes in walking distance. Hotel was clean & air conditioning worked well. One big complaint: the bathtub/shower. It was very difficult to climb in & out of the deep tub without slipping. There is no shower curtain, so its impossible not to get water all over the bathroom when you take a shower. Didn't find the staff (meaning the single person at the reception desk) to be particularly friendly. Sometimes the person on duty didn't speak any English. Don't depend on them if you have a lot of questions about Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A good value for this paris location”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer084
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property three different times on visits to Paris, most recently in early August, and feel that we are getting a very good value. While the furnishings and decor are a little dated, the rooms are generally a very good size for Paris with fairly modern bathroom facilities and with air conditioning that has always worked very well. The included continental breakfast consists of coffee, tea, or hot chocolate, with a basket of croissants, baguettes, and bread. You can order additional items such as eggs or orange juice for an extra charge. The bed is comfortable and the neighborhood is quiet for sleeping at night. There are not many restaurants close by, but many good choices within a 15 minute walk in various directions. The front desk staff has always been helpful with various small requests, and our weak attempts at using our limited French vocabulary seem to be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Acceptable...”
Reviews.Author: TBone_CA
Reviews.Content: Like many visitors to Paris, we were there to enjoy the city itself, so we wanted a hotel that is simple, well located, hassle-free, and decent value for the price. At l'Hotel du Palais Bourbon we pretty much got what we were looking for. The room was clean and had a large ( by Euro standards ) bathroom with a bidet, toilet, tub, shower and sink. There was a small single-car elevator that held up to three people. The room was quiet, had a thermostat, and the bathroom had a built in hairdryer ( perhaps best to check beforehand whether all rooms have this as it could save you from lugging one from home) Also in the room were a small TV, a kettle with instant coffee and tea and a half-full minibar -> .which was *perfect* for us as we could buy juice and milk at the grocery store down the block and keep it cool in the room. Breakfast is either served downstairs or delivered to your room. The complimentary part consisted of coffee, hot chocolate, warm milk, croissants, mini baguette, sliced country bread with butter and jam. The breads were all fresh and delicious. You can add a hard boiled egg or yogurt upon request and pay a reasonable charge for both. The hot chocolate was pretty watery. For any breakfast it's best to let the front desk clerk know your wishes the night before. The woman delivering the meals was pleasant and extremely hard working and spoke only French. We tipped her generously at the end of the week - although it is not expected. The breakfast is a good value-added service, but after several days we were hungry for a bit more vvariety and so we ate breakfast in nearby cafes and packed our unused breads and jams from the hotel every day to take with us for a snack. It worked out fine. Chacun a son gout. It took a fair while to build any rapport with the front desk staff. My rudimentary French from 25 years back helped a little - although they all spoke English they sensed I was trying at least. If you have a direct quiestion or request they will answer it for you, but we certainly never sensed they would ever go out of their way to help us. For example, we were not made aware that there was an airport shuttle service nor made aware of how one must order one's breakfast in advance the night before. Was this aloofness a Parisian thing or a Hotel du Palais Bourbon thing? Je ne sais pas. As mentioned in a previous post, the hotel is about a 15-25 minute walk from most of the major sites in Paris. This suited us fine and saved us a bit of cabfare and gave us a little exercise. Especially if you are travelling with people who have limited mobility be clear that it's twenty minutes to anywhere and not five minutes to anywhere on foot. Overall the hotel was good value and delivered what we needed. If the front desk staff were a little more service oriented ( even in the context of Paris ) this place would graduate from acceptable to excellent. Mais, c'est la vie!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelTroy7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for Bastille Day in 2009- a terrific hotel for a great price. My daughter loved the small bed in the corner of the room and made use of it often; exhausted from viewing Paris sights. The continental breakfast provided a great start to each day. Have already recommended this location to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: julz99
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel right around New Year's for four nights. The staff was nice, the breakfast service was great (we had it delivered to our room) and it was nice that everything was included in the price. The rooms were simple but large (especially the bathroom) and we loved the location - can pretty much walk anywhere or hop on the metro. Our biggest negative was the noise level - specifically as it relates to the doors of the units next to you. Just something to be aware of....but good value and quality relative to many of the other hotels we researched. Free high speed internet.

Reviews.Title: “This is a good find”
Reviews.Author: Travel21Boston
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated near Les Invalides in a very chic street. It is very quaint. The elevator is small and creeps up slowly but works. My room had everything I needed including a window box with geraniums when I opened the window! The shower area was a bit small but it didn't bother me. This is not a glitzy business hotel but the value is outstanding, The people who work there are very helpful and I enjoyed staying there very much. The price included a continental breakfast delivered to my room. Wireless internet was free. I would certainly stay there again and enjoyed the hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “a good base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: discerningofbayridge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for sightseeing in Paris, which we considered its best feature. The rooms were fine, clean and quite simple. The service at reception was somewhat Parisian (not exactly overflowing with charm!), and the breakfasts were basic continental - a croissant and some French bread for each person - but for the price we paid for 2 adults and 2 teenagers, we found it good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “This is a little Parisian Gem”
Reviews.Author: Bluepilot
Reviews.Content: Listed a few years ago in the Sunday Times as a Parisian "hidden gem" and that's what it is. We stayed for three nights in a four-bed room and, although we initially found the room not to have been prepared for our arrival (it was a total mess from the previous occupants!), Thierry, the owner, sorted it out promptly and was very apologetic. That aside, the room was clean and spacious, the breakfast of tea, coffee or hot chocolate and breads was more than enough to get you started for the day! One minor gripe would be that on the upper stairways, the carpet is a bit drab and the walls could do with a lick of paint, but as I say, this is a minor point and does not take away from the rooms and the great prices and the staff. Location is quite superb and there are two nearby Metrostops, Invalides and Varennes plus the Rodin museum is just around the corner. Thierry and his team (including his mum!) were efficient and helpful in all respects; Thierry even sorted out my flight tickets for the return trip! You may read this and wonder if it is this good; trust me, I've been in your shoes and would consider myself to be quite fussy and this one ticks the boxes. For me, this is the only hotel I'll use in future in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LouLouRoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here five nights total, and thoroughly enjoyed this 18th century building. A true French experience - don't expect a breakfast buffet of corn flakes and greasy doughnuts - you're in France, and will enjoy a French breakfast of breads and coffee or tea. There are plenty of shops nearby to purchase fresh fruits or pastries and meats if you choose. The rooms were quite adequate in size - we were there to see Paris, not the hotel room, and the size is typical of that found in any large city (e.g., New York). The staff was helpful, and after awhile (normal European reserve), was quite engaging. Of course, as with everyone, some are more outgoing than others, but we encountered nothing but courtesy and helpfulness.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: catsndogs2
Reviews.Content: I stayed 8 nights. The single room was small but adequate. The room was clean and the service was good. It was quiet at night and in a good neighborhood. The free continental breakfast and the closeness to the Varenne metro saved me a lot of time.

Reviews.Title: “not worth it”
Reviews.Author: deniseandwaldek
Reviews.Content: the guy on the desk that a few people have mentioned in their reviews, showed us to a room with wallpaper peeling off the wall due to mould and the room smelt of dampness. when we showed it to him, he acted like it was the first time he had noticed it (in a midly surprised was rather than shock and horror). then we were shown to a room with 2 beds. he said he had no other room for us and we could change it the next day. we had to take our luggage to reception and say that he either found us the room we had paid for or give us a refund. then he consulted to old woman who seems to be in charge and after much deliberating, they gave us a dark and dingy but ok attic room. i appreciate it does seem to be the guy on the desk's manner and nothing personal. nevertheless we were angry that there was not even so much of an apology. ti chose the hotel for the location but that wasn't so hot either. i thought it would be good being near the river but it was actually at nearer rue de grenelle and although near the metro, there wasnt much to see or do nearby. the rooms were clean and the breakfast was good, espec the hot chocolate. the other staff were very nice. i could see that this hotel may once have been worthy of 3 star rating but i think they've let things slip and its maybe not what it once was. i wouldn't recommend it anyone. we stayed in a lovely hotel des artes in montmatre for 1/3 of the price when we arrived in paris at the start of out holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Has potential for a nice 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: pelaminnesota
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 was looking for a reasonably priced hotel that was of good quality and a decent location. With rooms for 4 people hard to find in Paris, we were happy when we found they could fit all 4 of us into this room. The beds were comfy, one large one and two twins, and the tall ceilings and pretty draperies gave this hotel some charm. But the refrigerator was broken and the cranky manager refused to fix it or give us another one (which in hot July would have been appreciated- thankfully the A/C worked ok.) And the bathroom was updated and roomy, but a bit tacky with duct tape holding together the hair dryer. The small lift was convenient, but the halls were very dark and gloomy. Fortunately it was quiet. Breakfast was very basic. The first morning we went to the breakfast room in the basement. We were the only ones there, and it was very claustrophobic. After that, we took breakfast in our room. The location was interesting- it was very near the Rodin museum which was nice, but a good 10-15 minute walk to any kind of restaurant. This got a bit old after 2 days. We walked to the Orsay (about 30 min.) then hoofed it over to the Louvre (another 15-20 min.) But we knew when we made the reservation that this is in the Embassy area, and very quiet at night, which means not a lot of night life or eating opportunities. Cost was important to us since we were spending 3 weeks touring France and could not afford 4-star hotels. So it worked out ok for us, but perhaps next time we'd stay in the Latin Quarter or near the Louvre where we could get a better feel for old Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: RetiredLibrarian_8
Reviews.Content: This is a great budget hotel. From this location, you can walk to the Eiffel Tower, the Musee d'Orsay, and with comfortable shoes, all the way to Notre Dame. Metro stop is on the next block, and the RER to Versailles is a five minute walk. The rooms are a good size and the baths are large by European standards - but with a hand-held shower. Everything has been nicely updated (Flat screen TV in every room; Internet available in the lobby), yet the decor is decidedly French. Complimentary continental breakfast is limited to tea, coffee, breads & croissants and served in a charming basement. Additional items are available to be ordered. Though the desk staff appear brusque at first, if you need any help, advice, directions, etc., they are quite efficient. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “not a three-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: cantabulous
Reviews.Content: This hotel just got upgraded by the official French tourist office to three stars, but it's really still only a two-star place. The good things about this hotel: location, plenty of hot water, comfortable beds, quiet at night. Our so-called "superior" double room (around 150 euros) had adequate space and an ok bathroom. The bad: Our "regular" single room had a broken and tiny shower that was almost unusable. Anyone elderly or overweight would not be able to use it at all. There is no on-site manager to take care of problems. It took four days to change a burned-out lightbulb on a landing that was safety-critical. The maids leave sheets and towels strewn on the floor outside rooms for many hours. The wifi signal strength is so weak that using the web is almost impossible. The people behind the front desk don't understand what this means, whether one explains it in English or French. My guess is that the hotel got its third star by renovating a room off the lobby in kitschy fake medieval style. But this room is never used and they should have spent the money on better management and fixing the old bathrooms. Most of the people staying here were English-speaking, perhaps because this hotel is relatively well-ranked on Tripadvisor. Next time I'll try to find out where the French stay, and go there instead.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: justvisiting4444
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel du Palais Bourbon for five days in June. It was my second time in Paris and the first for my husband. This hotel is great for travelers who want to visit all the iconic sights of Paris: Eiffel Tower, Invalides, Louvre, Arc de Triomphe, and Musee Rodin. The hotel is two blocks from the Musee Rodin. The National Assembly and several embassies are located in the area. So it's super safe to walk around at all hours of the day or night. From the nearby Varenne Metro stop you can get to anywhere in the city. The best part beside the location is the fabulous breakfast of coffee, hot chocolate, juice, and incredible bread that comes to your room or in the breakfast room everyday--it's included in the price of the room, too. One less thing to worry about and pay for. We paid 137 Euros per night for a Superior Double bathtub room with floor to ceiling windows, a minibar, a great shower (plenty of pressure and hot water), and a queen size bed (made of two twins together). There is also wi-fi in the room (at a daily rate) and a business center stay connected or find out more information on the city. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to see Paris and have a lovely place to sleep and wake up in.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andymo50
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family suite on 5th floor, June 10,11 & 12, 2008. The family suite had one room with 2 singles and a desk and another room with 1 double and a desk. Ensuite bath had a sink, bidet, toilet & tub with a shower head but no curtain. Had to take a sit down shower which was fine. We could see the top of the Eiffel Tower from our window. Our room was lovely and the staff was freindly, helpful and made us feel welcome. Breakfast was good. The neighborhood is very nice and quiet. We felt very safe because this neighborhood houses many of the embassies so there is a larger than normal police presence in the area. On this street are a bakery, a butcher and a little grocery store, so our picnics were fun and delicious. There are several tiny cafes on the street and regular restaurants within a few blocks. 20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower or the Louvre. 10 minutes to Musee d' Orsay. This was my 1st time in France and I loved Paris. I would gladly stay here again the next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: wbatt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here with our 21 year old son. We found all members of the staff very friendly and they helped us with directions on several occasions. We never had to wait to be served breakfast. The quadruple room we stayed in was clean. We stayed for 9 days and for a two star hotel it is better than some three star hotels we have booked in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: worldseer
Reviews.Content: Due to lack of availability we had to spend our last night in Paris at a different hotel to the wonderful Hotel La Sanguine (see recommendations) at which we had just spent 3 nights. On arrival at du Palais Bourbon the receptionist continued to eat into a fish sandwich whilst handing over our key. The room was a good size (it was a quadruple) but the brown paint was drab. Bathroom was fine. Breakfast was chaotic. The breakfast room is downstairs in the cellar (no windows). If the waitress is there you are lucky. If not, people were clearing tables already vacated so they could sit down & hopefully wait for service. After a reasonable wait, both myself and another guest went back up the stairs to reception to find out what was happening about breakfast service. Juice is not included in the breakfast price here. On checkout we did not even receive a 'merci' or goodbye. Highly unusual for the French. I overheard plenty of complaints including one from some American guests regarding confusion over an email booking. As the guests said, if the dates are there in writing how can confusion arise? Interesting that we were at the hotel on the same dates as the guest who has written the complaint regarding bed bugs....No way would I recommend this hotel to anyone at present.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Quindim
Reviews.Content: The reviews that I read here was crucial to choose this hotel and I couldn't choose a better one. We tooked two quadruple standart rooms, and it was clean, spacious and well mainteined, as same as the bathrooms. A simple but basic good breakfast was a good start for long days in Paris. The staff, day or night, was really friendly, helpful, nice and try their best to understand and comunicate with us, since our group doesn't speak a good english or french. The neighboorhood was quiet and safe, there are a few good restaurants in the hotel street, a little market that works until 21h and a 24h mini market, a metro station just around the corner. The Hotel is near from every attraction in Paris, you can easily walk to the Eiffel tower, Louvre, Champs ElysÃ©e, Sena, Place du Concorde, Grand Palais and Petit Palais, Les Invalides, Orsay, Ã“pera and Lafayette Galleries. This was a golden choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seanog2ie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for six night, Two adults & 2 children 14 & 10. We found it very clean and the staff friendly. I know that there are others who have not found this but all the staff we dealt with were extremely helpful. Having the breakfast included was brilliant, you can also order cheese, ham and orange juice as extras. It set us up for the day. The location could not be better. It is 2 mins walk form metro. If you want to walk places then Notre dame is 30 mins, musee d'orsay 15 mins, Eifel tower about 20 min. The invalides is just around the corner. You can get metro direct to Versailles, the trip is about 30 mins. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not American Friendly”
Reviews.Author: WillAlexSmirh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Paris several times. Hotel du Palais Bourbon seemed to have everything. It is convenient for business and touring. The only problem....... The concierge/night-watchman was more anti-american than any Parisian I've ever met. I'm no gunslinging loudmouth [--]. I was visiting an old French family friend. The staff was very vocally anti-american. I expected a bit of teasing, but the staff were beyond rude. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to enjoy their time in Paris. Im not one to complain, but I was so angry with the service that after one night I left the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, I will come back!”
Reviews.Author: Sasch
Reviews.Content: I have chosen this hotel because of the feedback on TripAdvisor and it did not disappoint. I spent 5 nights there with a friend in a very spacious three-bed room (no. 5), everything was more than ok. What I particularly liked is the fact that the bathroom was very usable and spacious and that everyday it was made spotlessly clean, which is not always the case in Paris. And then the location: go beyond the Invalides and you will see some of the most palatial art deco residences in Paris, not to mention the Eiffel tower and the Palais Chaillot. If you go in the opposite direction, a ten-minutes walk brings you to Rue de Bac and further on Rue de Sevres, probably the best up-market shopping in all of Paris. Next to the hotel there is a practical little shop and the whole neighborhood had more than enough places to eat or just sit around. Hotel personnel was very nice and helpful, right down to the last Chinese (?) cleaning lady who wished me Bon Voyage and to come back in the future. Now, I don't remember hearing anything like that from places in Paris costing five times more!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: aytacsen
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel for people who are looking for ~130 Euros price range per night. Breakfast included. (Including croissant, bread, jam, butter, and nice coffee) The rooms were clean, bathrooms were perfect (most probably recently renovated, kept clean all the time) Refrigerator, LCD TV are other plus points. There are two supermarkets which are really close (2 meters) to the hotel. The location is great as well, close to Invalides metro station. At night you can easily walk to Pont Alexander III and enjoy a nice view of Eiffel Tower. I found this hotel from TripAdvisor and definitely enjoyed the stay. :)

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: highway61nola
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and daughter in August 2007 for three nights during a great trip to Paris. As other reviews have noted, there is not a lot in the immediate area of visitor interest except the Rodin museum. The Varenne metro station is handy, however. We were in an interior room and there was no street noise. The neighborhood was deserted at night, but there is nothing seedy or unsafe about it even after 11 PM on two nights. The room was clean and well-maintained. The beds in our triple were basic but fine. The grocery store nearby was nice to have to pack a lunch or get a bottle of wine for the room. We had a nice dinner at the Vietnamese restaurant nearby. The Sunday PM desk clerk was clearly one of the jerky ones that other posters have referred to...rather brusque and rude, perhaps in need of a personality transplant. The only day clerk (owner?) I interacted with was fine, if not cheerful. He obtained a taxi for us with no problems. I required no extensive dealings with any of the desk staff so might not have had cause to evoke some of the behaviors others have noted. I like more than just coffee and croissants for breakfast so I didn't care for that aspect, but I knew in advance that that was the deal, so it's not a complaint. However, I was not aware other things were available for the asking like juice, cheese, etc. No one told me that and that would be nice to know. All in all, no major complaints, but also nothing compelling to make me want to return. I would stay somewhere else next time and if I could afford a week in Paris, I would definitely rent a flat instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SaarB
Reviews.Content: We have just returned. This hotel is rated officialy two starts, but it's better than all 3 stars...Refrigerator at the room, LCD TV and nice clean toilets. We were at room 4 â€“ very quite. The location is great â€“ 1.5minutes from the Metro, 2 nice groceries 2meter from the hotel. Street is quite and very safe (even after midnight).

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel du Palais Bourbon”
Reviews.Author: KiddoConnecticut
Reviews.Content: My friend and I travelled to Paris two weeks ago, a busy week there, Fashion Week and the beginning of Rugby Madness. We were able to just barely book a room in this delightful, little hotel on the Left Bank. The hotel has number of kinds of rooms and we stayed in a few. Though small they were charming. Every morning we had a delicious coffee (Starbucks eat your heart out) and croissants or bread, though a few mornings we had breakfast in our room. The servers were charming and the men who manned the desk were professional as well as engaging when conversations occured. It is located around the corner from the Rodin museum and close to Les Invalides. The only sad part was that we had to leave. A little gem of a place.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but”
Reviews.Author: vacation050
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a good experience. The room was quite large, and well kept. The ensuite bathroom was more than adequate, up to date and very clean(on more than one occasion we were short clean glasses, and or facecloths and towels). The personality of the front desk clerk(days) left a bit to be desired. The breakfast was a true continental, although breakfast eggs, OJ, cheese etc. could be ordered at additional cost, except on Sunday morning, there didn't appear to be a cook available. Also, the English communication skills of the breakfast room staff were non existant, which created a little bit of a problem.

Reviews.Title: “central to everything but not close to anything”
Reviews.Author: airsonu
Reviews.Content: My 2 teenage daughters and I stayed at Hotel Palais Bourbon when visiting Paris. It offered a triple room that had a queen bed for my 2 daughters and a single bed for me. The room was very spacious for Paris standards and had modern amenities. The electronic lock on the door assured security. The flat panel LCD TV was nice. The A/C provided relief from the summer humidity. The bathroom had a tub and shower, and a toilet and separate bidet. The bathroom was of a nice size and well lit. Wi-Fi internet service was available for a fee. The room had a small foyer. The door to the right was the bathroom. The door ahead was the bedroom. The door to the left was a coat and towel closet. The room had a very high ceiling, approximately 12 feet, which made it feel additionally spacious to the already large floor area. The included breakfast was good and consisted of croissants, bread, coffee, and hot chocolate served either in the dining hall or in the room. The hotel staff was very courteous and provided much help in securing a taxi to the airport, offering to mail our postcards, directions, and general help. The road in front of the hotel (rue de Bourgogne) had moderate traffic. However, the noise of even 1 small car was echoed and amplified considerably by the stone buildings along the narrow road. We had to keep the room windows closed to block the noise at night. The location was our biggest disappointment. Although the hotel is central to many sites - about a 10 minute walk to Invalides, 25 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower, 25 minutes from Saint Germain, and about 30 minutes from the Concorde, there are almost no people, open shops, or activities immediately around the hotel after 7pm. We walked from Saint Germain to the hotel at 11pm a couple times. Except for the police patroling the roads near the government buildings, few other people could be seen. I would recommend a taxi to return to the hotel in the late evening. A few doors down from the hotel is a small grocery store from which we purchased sandwiches, fruits, drinks, and snacks for our daytrips. If you want a hotel with modern amenities and spacious rooms at an affordable price, then Palais Bourbon is a good choice. If you want a hotel closer to night-life, shops and restaurants, then Palais Bourbon is not a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay in a mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: louisehall7
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at 12.30pm (check-in at 2pm), we were given the keys to our room immediately - I was impressed! Unfortunately when we entered our room I knew this was not the one we had booked - it had 1 double and 1 single bed - we had booked AND received confirmation for a superior family room with 2 separate bedrooms (1 double/2 single). I went to the desk and asked if we had been given the right room and showed him my confirmation e-mail - he said we did have the correct room. I wasn't convinced! On my return I noticed on the door the description of the room - it said it was a 'triple'. I went back to the desk and asked if he could check that a mistake hadn't been made as there were 4 of us and there wasn't enough beds. Eventually he admitted that a colleague had made a mistake but they had no other rooms available. We didn't get a 'sorry' anywhere only a 'you don't come on holiday to be grumpy' - I could not beleive what I was hearing - this man was the most arrogant and rude person I have met and definately should not be in the hospitality business. I think he was the owner but am not sure. To add more insult to injury he even tried to charge us the family room rate! Unbelievable! Anyway a bit about the standards, our room was number 2 and on the first floor. We were directly above the reception desk and everytime a cigarette was smoked the smell came into our room - it was disgusting. At night the street was noisy. The TV had 1 English speaking channel (nothing unusual about this tho!) the picture was snowy and screen very small. The room was not cleaned well and hadn't had a good fettle for a long time - even my daughter commented on this! The fridge was ancient and didn't shut properley - when we came back one day it was left wide open - I can only assume the cleaner had been in to see if we had anything from the mini bar. I just wish I had read ALL the reviews instead of just the first few, all the negative comments reflect our experience. This is definately a 2 star hotel and not worthy of anything else. There are hundreds of better hotels out there for the same if not lower tariff.

Reviews.Title: “C'est Magnifique (It's wonderful)”
Reviews.Author: Wohlfies
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful 2 Star hotel in a very quiet, well protected area of Paris. It's on the Rue de Bourgogne, close to the Rodin Museum, Les Invalides, The Orsay museum, the Seine, The Rue Cler and only a short distance to the Eiffel Tower. We walked everywhere from our beautiful, spacious, elegant yet quaint and cozy hotel. It had more amenities than many of the three star hotels we stayed at during our 16 days in France. Our family of 4 (kids are quite picky about accomodations) all thought that this was our favorite. We even had a chandelier in the master bedroom. The bathroom facilities were new and very modern. Can't say enough!!! The staff was very helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but the desk staff are awful”
Reviews.Author: mkenmass2000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice and clean and in a good area but the staff who work the desk are absolutely horrible. I had several encounters with the desk staff that left a bad tast in my mouth. They are rude and indifferent, they lied to me about the airport shuttle and several times about calling taxis. the front desk is not staffed 24 hours and if you arrive after 10 pm you have to ring a bell and wait. When the desk staff arrive they are angry and rude. Breakfast is a comedy. I would suggest eating out. The desk staff are not french so I can rule out the old wives tale of the french rudeness. I speak fluent french but chose to use english while I was there and more than once I caught the desk staff in lies.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cmaloney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 Nights ...... the location could not have been better .... yes , it is a quiet area. However, it is centrally located. For our needs as a tourist it was perfect. Bathrooms were recently renovated ..... AC worked great .... suprisingly, the staff was very attentive ...... if you plan on tipping the maids , tip them early ...... it will go a long way. The Hotel staff was pleasant and very helpful. Yes, the breakfast was the same every day however it is only coffee and bread ...... it was perfect. If you are looking for value this is a great hotel .......

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bvl
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, clean, up-to-date hotel in a quiet, centrally located neighborhood. We stayed in a family suite (2 separate bedrooms) on the top floor and it was quite roomy for 2 adults and 2 children. We could see the top of the Eiffel Tower from our window. The front desk was pleasant. The breakfast was not too exciting (croissant and roll), but we had no problem eating it 3 days in a row. There is a metro station about 2 blocks away. It is not on a main line, but we didn't find that to be a problem - just transfer. There are not a lot of restaurant choices in the neighborhood. You may have to walk a little to get a better selection. The Rodin Museum is just down the street and Les Invalides is a few blocks away. The Eiffel Tower is about a 20-30 minute walk. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: flymeaway2
Reviews.Content: I am late in posting this review (we stayed here in September 2007), but I have to say my husband and I were extremely pleased with our stay at Hotel du Palais Bourbon. We short-listed this hotel from close to 50 hotels and e-mailed over 20 within our price range. After much deliberation about location, room size, what was included and what not, to overall appearance, we chose this hotel. We choose and book all our accommodation when travelling ourselves and no decision is taken lightly. The room was spacious which is a definite plus in a large European city. The breakfast was adequate and included in the rate. The location was perfect for us. The bathroom had a shower and was very, very clean. We could not find any fault whatsoever and we would definitely consider returning to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice bargain”
Reviews.Author: Hotguymike
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2004. Rooms: small, but all rooms in Paris are! Clean and comfortable. Location: Good. Restaurants on same street, a few meters from the hotel. Grocery down the street less than two blocks. Ten minute walk to Metro and River Seine. Staff: Friendly and attempted to speak English. A little French went a long way. Breakfast: Typical continental, but satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Value & Comfort”
Reviews.Author: SeraBey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our oasis while staying in Paris in July. It was our fist trip to Paris and the heat wave was soaring. The airconditioning in the rooms saved our trip. We had a controler in our room which allowed us to keep the room very comfortable (like in US hotels), unlike many European hotels with airconditoning,. We traveled with our two sons and booked a very generous sized suite (for Paris standards). The room had a good sized bathroom, with plenty of towels. Clean and spacious. The main bedroom had a plasma screen TV (big hit with the kids) with English channels, a large bed (I think it was king), a small table and 4 chairs which we used to eat take in dinners and breakfast. There was also plenty of closet space to unpack and store our suit cases. Off the main bedroom was a long narrow room with two twins end to end where our children slept comfortably. The breakfast was generous and delicious. The hotel is a half a block from the Rodin Museum and around the corner from the Invaldes building and subway access. I felt very safe in the city in general, but in this area in particular since it is surrounded with government buildings and embassies and the police are visible. Quiet street - and thick windows sound deadening when it wasn't. One morning from our hotel we walked to the Orsay Museum in about 15 min. I have nothing negative to add - I plan on staying there again if I go back to Paris - and have already recommended the hotel to several other people.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the money”
Reviews.Author: Post765
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it's pros and cons. Having just returned, and the dollar being so weak, it was a relief to be paying "only" 175 euros for the "family room" at this hotel. The room was very small for 5 people, but served its purpose since we didn't spend very much time there. Unlike most hotels, at least breakfast was included. I do agree with others, however, that some variety would have been nice. I did, like others, find outlets to be a problem. These days with the necessity to recharge phones, computers, video cameras, etc. this was a bit of an incovenience. I did feel very safe in the neighborhood. It is quite residential and quiet, but the Varenne metro is very accessible. Easy walking distance to the Rodin, Hotel des Invalides, and about 20 minutes to the Eiffel Tower and D'Orsay and 25 minutes to Saint Suplice. The staff was okay, they ordered taxis for our early morning departure, but other than that we didn't ask for much help from them. It was definitely a 2 star hotel, as it is rated. I would probably stay somewhere else next time, mainly though just to experience another neighborhood. But for the price I don't think I would have found much better right now to sleep 5 people.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be trusted”
Reviews.Author: astranav
Reviews.Content: The main problem we had at this hotel was either a deliberate attempt to cheat us or a highly incompetent desk clerk... Right on a sign on the front desk, the hotel advertises a shuttle that takes people to the airport from the hotel for 17 euros per person. As we had more luggage with us this time than we have had in the past, we didn't want to mess with taking the metro and RER, so at the very beginning of our 5-day stay at the hotel, I asked how far in advance the shuttle had to be reserved, and the clerk said just a day before, and that he would make a note of it and call to reserve it for us the day before we were leaving. Every day thereafter we reconfirmed these plans with the desk clerk, pointing to the shuttle sign, etc., and he assured us every time that, yes, he remembered. So the morning we were leaving, he said something to my husband about how the "taxi" would be arriving shortly. My husband had a bad feeling and, as I speak French fluently, he asked me to verify with the clerk that it was the shuttle for the airport. I specifically pointed to the sign for the shuttle and said, "It is this one, not a regular taxi, right?" The clerk's response was to act completely dumbfounded and tell me "Well no! YOU asked me for a taxi! I even showed you the note I had written to remind me to get you the taxi!" Blah blah blah. I had never used the word "taxi" at all, and I had pointed directly to the sign for the shuttle and asked about it specifically when we had asked him to reserve it. There was absolutely no question about what we had wanted. At one point the clerk tried to chalk the problem up to a language barrier, which is ridiculous, although I do think it's possible his French is not much better than his English. He continued to argue and act very rude to me and my husband, and asked if we wanted him to cancel the taxi, which we did not because we didn't have time to arrange anything else. The taxi ended up costing us 50 euros, and I have to say that the taxi driver and the desk clerk seemed to know each other fairly well. Aside from this headache, the room, while generally spacious and well-enough decorated, was not well-cleaned. Our trash had not been emptied from the previous guest, and there was something sticky on the bathroom floor. The inside of the little refrigerator was dirty as well. There was also a vent in the bathroom that seemed to do nothing but pipe in large doses of cigarette smoke. The street on which the hotel is situated is also much louder late into the night than what you might expect for this area. I should also note that, when I initially contacted the hotel for a reservation, I specifically asked if there is a lower rate for the room alone, NOT including breakfast. I was told that no, the room plus breakfast is the only option. On the sheet posted on the back of the door in the room, however, there were indeed two prices listed- 125 euros for the room plus breakfast, or 119 euros for the room alone. The breakfast, incidentally, was delivered half an hour late to our room 3 mornings in a row, and I suspect the only reason it got delivered at all was because I eventually broke down and called reception each morning to ask where it was. In case he reads this, I will say that the night clerk with glasses was always kind and well-mannered.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent (and sometimes difficult staff) in an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: j'adoreparis
Reviews.Content: These are my impressions of the Hotel du Palais Bourbon, where I stayed for 1 week. I would have given the hotel a higher rating, but it let me down in three ways: its staff, its location, and its value. The hotel's biggest flaw lies in its staff. The older gentleman (with the white hair and bushy brows) who works the reception in the mornings is very difficult, and clearly not cut out to work in the service industry. I observed him as a guest approached him with "I have a question", and his reply was a huff followed by a "I hope I can give you an answer." He acts as if his guests are all too much trouble for him. Any request is met with resistance and condescension. The rest of male staff were also quite indifferent, and generally gloomy-looking, except for the gentleman in the glasses who works the night shift. He was very friendly and helpful. The only smiles I saw during my stay came from the ladies who do the cleaning, and from the lovely young lady who serves breakfast every morning. The always greeted guests with a happy "bonjour", or asked if you had slept well. The rave reviews this hotel receives are based on guests who had the luck of staying in the renovated rooms, that is to say, some rooms have newly renovated bathrooms and bedrooms, and others do not. The singles in the 4th floor have not been renovated, and have scratched floors, dirty area rugs, and tired old bathrooms. The only electricity plugs in these rooms are located where the TV and the hairdryer are plugged, not very convenient to charge phones, and other electronic items. The room rate includes breakfast, which consists of 1 croissant, 1 crusty bun, butter, jam, and coffee per person. If you're looking for breakfast variety, you won't find it here. The location of the hotel is ok if you value quietness over accessibility. The area is upper middle class residential, home to many ministries, and embassies, thus making it quite safe. The nearest metro station is Varenne, line 13, but this is not a main line, and many changes are required to get to main areas of interest and attractions. Its location near Invalides makes it accessible on foot to the heat of Saint-Germain-des-Pres (10-15 minutes). I chose this hotel because it offered air conditioned rooms, but the said A/C was weak at best. It was not worth forking out the extra cash to secure a room with A/C when it barely did the job properly. For a hotel of the same category, in a better location (rue de Seine) try Hotel de Seine (with A/C), or Welcome Hotel. Both are located on rue de Seine, close to everything, have excellent staff, and offer similar or better prices than Hotel du Palais Bourbon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location at a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: BusinessUser1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a few days holiday for my family. Thank goodness for Tripadvisor! Its a nice, friendly hotel on a quiet street 10mins walk from the Place de La Concorde, Musee D'orcy, Louvre. We even walked to the Eiffel Tower in 20Mins. Our room was spacious for 4 of us and the en suite bathroom was modern and spotless. It had a fridge / mini bar with water and beer. It also had a Safe that we found very useful. The temperatures were over 30Degrees on our visit so the Air Con was an essential asset. The hotel provides a basic continental breakfast - coffee / croissants and bread and jam. It doesn't provide Lunch or Evening meals. I hope that we will visit Paris again soon, its a fantastic city, and when we do we will book this hotel without hesitation......I hope their popularity will not push up the prices!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: onward
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Paris during a heat wave. The lobby and halls are not air conditioned at all. Our room thankfully had a wall air conditioner unit on it. However, the air didn't make it to the small room in which our teens were using. We were not familiar with the rules about leaving the keys at the front desk when we left as we were not told when we first checked in. The first night we came back very hot and exhausted and we were met with a somewhat surprising lecture from the fellow at the desk about leaving our keys there. The room and hotel are above average. The bathroom was very nice with a large tub to soak in after a long walk. The lady who delivered our buns / croissant and hot choclate in the morning was very nice. The desk staff I don't know if it was because of the heat or if they were just indifferent to their guests at this particular time. It would have made us feel more comfortable to be greeted with a smile rather than indifference.

Reviews.Title: “Definately stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: DaHa
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel! After staying in the world's smalled hotel room in London, we were so pleasantly surprised by our spaceous room at this hotel. The staff are very friendly, although English is limited, so be prepared. Breakfast was served daily and was yummy but a little boring after a few days. The rooms were large, bright, and clean and had air conditioning! There is internet access for a fee. The location is great...we could walk to the Seine in under 10 minutes or around the corner to the metro stop. I would definately stay here on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “A Six-Year Love Affair!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I first visited this delightful hotel in the spring of 2000. It stole my heart, and I've been staying there for every visit to Paris since. Our room in June 06 was lovely; a third-floor open-space en-suite with an enourmous bathroom. Our windows looked down to the street below, a boisterous area with the perfect and delightful sounds of Parisian mornings! When you venture out, as soon as you reach the end of the block, you'll see the shimmering gold dome of Ivalides (Napoleon's Tomb). It's breathtaking, and provides a first taste of the "Paris" that will unfold before you. My only negative for this consistently-fantastic hotel is that the secret is out, and it's not the hotel's fault. The prices have raised considerably yearly as the hotel has grown in popularity. It's well-earned. I'd love to have my quiet respite back, at yesterday's prices, but the hotel has gained in popularity because of its location and excellence. IA top-notch pick, and "my place" in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: RacheleAustralia
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel purely from the trip advisor reviews We are a family of 5 (3 children). This hotel was able to accomodate us in one room which had a King sized bed plus an extra single as well as an annex which included two more single beds. Our room has its own en-suite bathroom which I presume all rooms have. Hotel bath is very high so check this if you have difficulties entering and exiting the bathtub. Entire hotel was clean. Towels were freshly laudered and still felt warm when we used them. Breakfast is a collection of croissants and bread rolls. Hot coffee, tea and chocolate is also offered which is supposed to be ordered via the hotel staff the evening before. Internet acces is available outside the breakfast room and when I used this, I didnt need to pay - it was just there and activated. However I later learnt that there is actuallly a charge. Guess I was lucky. There is a lift for all the luggage. We were not offered any assistance with our bags and that was the only tiny negative about the hotel. I prebooked a shuttle service to collect us from the airport including 5 pieces of luggage. I would highly recommend this service as they were prompt, poilte and drove safely...[--]

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't imagine better for the money”
Reviews.Author: brunoandmolly
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel which we selected on the basis of positive reviews on tripadvisor up to March 2006. We had an excellent double room on the first floor; bright and airy, quiet, bigger than we expected, excellent bed and marvellous new bathroom with bath and shower over. We did not mind that it overlooked a light well. We found all the good things we read on tripadvisor were true: location, access to metro, nearby stores and helpful staff. Molly got the best haircut she has had in 20 years from the hairdresser across the road and to the left. We also learned to trust the cafe/restaurant recommendations of the hotel, especially Le Bistrot du 7Ã¨me where we twice enjoyed the â‚¬19 fixed price menu. Just before we arrived we read a review by an LA Times travel writer, rating this one of the top 6 small hotels in Paris. We rate it 5/5 because we cannot imagine better at anywhere near the money.

Reviews.Title: “A comment on the computer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous reviewers that this is a very nice hotel. We were traveling with our children and stayed in a large family room. Staff is very helpful and accomodating. Note that the Internet in the lobby requires an extra charge (10 to 25 euros) and is tricky to use because of the lack of software and the strange keyboard. You can check your email, but you won't be able to open e-tickets (if they are in .pdf format) or do serious day-trip planning. Not a big deal, but nice to know ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “very french great location”
Reviews.Author: cakemaker
Reviews.Content: My fifteen year old daughter and I spent a weekend here in November, It was in a lovely little street and very handy for everything.We had a large room which was very clean and comfortable and the manager was very helpful even allowing my daughter to e-mail from behind the reception.The breakfast was the same every day but there was a small fridge in our room and plenty of shops round about. We felt very safe in the area and even walked to the tower quite late at night...mind you we walked very quickly and close together! The tower at night is magical on the hour and the view terrific. We had a lovely lunch at the D'orsay in the lovely blue and gold mirrored restaurant overlooking the river and it was very reasonable.We will definately use the same hotel again for a brilliant weekend base.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean with large rooms and a very luxurious large bathroom with a large tub and a moveable shower nozzle. The hotel is in a central well to do neighborhood in the central part of Paris very close to the Palace Invalides and not far from the Eiffel Tower. Great restaurants are not far away and it is close to the subway which will take you very quickly to anywhere you want to go in Paris. The staff also speaks English. And this is a great hotel for a family. Four people can stay in a single room which is often hard to find in Europe. The hotel is a bargain to for the city of Paris an expensive city. I could never ever stay at another hotel in the city unless I was filthy rich.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ralex
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the Palais Bourbon for one night, but the room was much larger than our more expensive room across the street at the Hotel de Varenne. The wallpaper was peeling a little, but the bathroom was modern and clean. We had a double bed and a single bed in the same room, which was perfect for our three member family. The room is nothing fancy with white bedspreads, but it had a nice size flat screen TV. However, like the Varenne, the only English channels are CNN, BBC News, and BBC Sports. The hotel usually offers a good price for the location and room size. One member of the staff was especially friendly, but I did not get his name. Safe area near several embassies and government offices.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: RATSOMATIC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with our children (11 & 8) and was very pleased. Located in a quiet street near Invalides and the Seine and convenient for Musee D'Orsay, Place de la Concorde, Tuilleries, Rue St Germain etc. Fairly spacious double room with an adjoining small room just large enough for two single beds. Bathroom was clean and modern. Breakfast in the brightly renovated cellar was standard French fare. Overall would recommend for price and location and was refreshing not to have the kids either in the same room or having to pay for two separate ones.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific choice”
Reviews.Author: cubbysmom
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a budget hotel in Paris that is spotlessly clean, includes breakfast, gets CNN, and has air conditioning and an elevator, this is the hotel for you. This hotel has been described as "almost a 3 star" and I would say that is accurate - it was much cleaner than many of the "3 stars" some of my colleagues were staying at. (in fact two colleagues checked out of their filthy 3 star hotel and moved into this hotel). The desk staff all spoke English and were helpful with directions, etc. The mattress was on the firm side, but I like it that way and I didn't wake up with a backache the way I usually do in budget (and some expensive) hotels. The bathroom was tiled in white with no mold in the bath/shower. The hardwood floor and rather spare curtains and furnishings were better for my asthma as there was no dust. The room had a small refrigerator. I had a double room that was larger than expected for Paris; I also peeked in some single rooms that were larger than the usual. My friends on a higher floor had some water stains just below the ceiling near the window and their room was a bit smaller than mine and seemed less recently refurbished. My room faced the street and there was a lot of street noise with the windows open, so I ended up turning on the air conditioning and closing the windows at night and then the room was very quiet. Breakfast was quintessentially Parisian - a croissant and a hard roll with butter and Jelly and beverage (tea, coffee or chocolate), consumed in the lovely breakfast room or delivered to your room. I found it satisfying and delicious, but if you expect more you'll have to visit one of the neighboring patisseries, boulangeries, groceries or cafes. The location was perfect for me, two blocks from the Maison de la Chimie where I was attending a conference. It is in a safe, non-tourist area with many embassies and high end shops. It is less than two blocks from the Varenne metro station, steps from the Rodin museum, and about a mile to a mile and a half from most Paris attractions (a bit farther from Notre Dame and Montmartre, where I took the Metro instead of walking). I normally wear a pedometer and walk at least 10,000 steps a day at home; in Paris I averaged about 17,000 steps per day by walking instead of taking the bus or metro, but buffered the extra effort by breaking up the walks with cafe and shopping stops. Criticism? There were two steps up to the elevator landing, and the bathtub was raised and had no grab-bars and thus would not be suitable for a senior or someone with limited mobility. If you're travelling with a senior citizen or someone with limited mobility spend the money for a higher end more Americanized hotel. I can also see from some Paris hotel reviews that some tourists have "Americanized" expectations. If you are looking for a Westin "heavenly bed" or plush carpets and furnishings or thick Turkish towels or a large room you should not be looking in the budget category in Paris. I think that this hotel is one of the best budget class values in Paris and I would stay here again in a heartbeat, but it is a budget class hotel, not the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “3.5 stars value for the price of 2 stars, family perfect”
Reviews.Author: RobCh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Palais Bourbon with our 2 teenage girls for 5 nights in July 2005. This is a hotel which gives you great value for your money. This is a charming Parisian style, < 40 room establishment, with a well maintained exterior and interior. The hotel has a clean facade with modern sound proof windows, 100% refreshed hallways and staircases, a georgeous stone-walled breakfast room downstairs, a typical tiny elevator on a safe and quiet street (quiet for Paris). Our room on the top floor was really a large 2 bedroom with 2 windows and some charm: ceilings were partly slanted, the modern bathroom had a bidet and the dark wood furniture was solid and heavy. The room had 2 tables and 4 well uppholstered comfortable chairs which were convenient for having small meals to save on Euros (+ a small fridge). Our bed was particularly comfortable while the girl's single beds were OK. Breakfast was delivered to our room every morning (as we elected for that option) on time and professionally by staff in uniform. While the room decor was a bit dated, we did not care as everything else made up for this (what do you expect from a 2 star hotel ?). We had no problem whatsoever with inside or outside noise. Location was excellent, although expect to walk a lot (ex. crossing the long Invalides esplanade to go places). Walk to rue Cler is a good 25-30 minutes and Eiffel tower about 40-45 minutes. The Varenne subway station is closeby but expect to transfer lines to get to most tourist highlights. For food, there is a nice bakery (highly service oriented) on the opposite side of the street where they will warm up your quiches and sandwiches and sell you delicious salads. We suggest you go to the Super Proxy grocery store (green and yellow sign) for a good selection of food items. This is a about a 1 minute walk from the hotel towards the Seine river. You may want to avoid the other small grocery store on the street where prices are about double. Staff is cordial, period. Expect profesionalism but don't expect them to go out of their ways to provide assistance. The owner Mrs Claudon is a distinguished and pleasant lady while her son tries to follow in her footsteps. Only issue we had during our stay was that the a/c was out for 1 day and does not seem to be quite powerful enough. We would definitely go back to Hotel Palais Bourbon and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a charming, no frills, reasonably priced accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: MissJoeyCR
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with this hotel. We had an amazing special rate of 120Euros for a triple room with air conditioning, a full bathroom and breakfast included. The hotel was very clean and quiet, was located in a lovely calm area within walking distance to many sights and the staff was helpful. They provided many maps and even had daily English language newspapers. The breakfast did not vary so it would get boring after a few days but it filled us up for sightseeing - coffee, tea or hot chocaolate and a roll with butter and jam and a fresh croissant. However, there was the option to order a full breakfast with eggs and juice at an added price. I have stayed in budget hotels in Paris before and they had dark, tiny rooms with no air conditioning, the shower in the hall and you could hear every conversation in the rooms next to you. The Hotel du Palais Bourbon was a very refreshing surprise! I would definitely stay here again and again ann would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Palais Bourbon is in an excellent location - a 10 minute walk from the Seine and Place de la Concorde. The rooms are clean, with an up-to-date bathroom. The beds are comfortable and the housekeeping services are very good. There is a mini fridge and safe in the room, which is very convenient. The hotel location is on a quiet street and although we were there during the busy tourist season, we slept soundly all three nights. It is a safe and clean area to stay in. We felt safe and secure all the time. The hotel staff is nice, but not overly friendly. They were helpful in answering questions, taking our tea/coffee order before retiring for the night (for breakfast the following morning) and kept our key at the reception for us while we were out visiting Paris. The breakfast consists of a bread roll and a croissant, jam and butter, tea, coffee or hot chocolate. This is a traditional french breakfast, although it would have been nice to have cheese or yogurt. Regardless, the breakfast was filling and fresh. There are 2 small grocery stores nearby, although I would recommend the store located on the way to the Seine as it is cheaper and has more selection. There is also a wonderful bakery, which sells fresh bread and desserts. We took bread with us to eat (along with cheese and meats from the grocery store) during the day, since eating and drinking in Paris is very expensive. There is also a bank machine on the rue de Bourgogne and we had no problems pulling money with our credit cards. There is street parking, although very limited. Parking is available at Place des Invalides (public lot), but the parking is expensive at 25â‚¬ per day. It would be recommended to take the train or a flight into Paris and avoid driving into the city. The public transportation system in Paris is very good, so there are no worries in having access to any of ParisÂ´ major monuments. We took a 2 day pass on the Open Bus Tour (city tour) and it was excellent and efficient. It cost 28â‚¬ per person for 2 days and passengers get on and get off at the various stops - at all the highlights of Paris. There are buses every 10 to 20 minutes, so there is no time wasted in waiting for the next ride. Passengers buy their ticket on the bus and can purchase a ticket at any of the stop locations. But donÂ´t forget to get your Open Tour map on the bus as you get on. It was invaluable! This is a great way to see the city. Hotel du Palais Bourbon is definitely worth the price and worth a stay, if only for its location. Everything is within walking distance and if you are looking for the parisian experience, staying in the heart of Paris will offer you just that! It is highly recommended and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A find!”
Reviews.Author: enniscs
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Palais Bourbon is a two minute walk to the Rodin Museum, ten minute walk to les Invalides and five minutes from the Varennes metro station. There is also a small grocery store on the street a few doors away from the hotel. We had two room for three nights in March. One was a three person room that had a sleeping alcove for the third person. The rooms were clean and quiet, even though our rooms faced the street. There was a complimentary continental breakfast served either in a pleasant lobby or in the room. There is no concierge, but the manager made two dinner reservations for our party. We liked the convenient location and would return.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel du Palais Bourbon
HotelInfo.Address: 49 rue de Bourgogne, 75007 Paris, France
